alert.note: Alert for Jay (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 9:27PM EST until March 05 at 5:45AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...Ohio... Michigan... Salamonie River at Portland affecting Jay County. Saint Marys River near Decatur affecting Allen IN, Van Wert and Adams Counties. Saint Joseph River Michigan at Niles affecting St. Joseph, Cass MI and Berrien Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Salamonie River at Portland. * WHEN...From this evening to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Low spots along the walking trails, including the picnic pavilion, at the Hudson Family Park flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Friday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
